terrapeer.vui.j3dui.utils
Class BoundsUtils

public class BoundsUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Contains constants and utilities of general use for object bounds.

Constructor Detail

BoundsUtils

public BoundsUtils()
Method Detail

allowGetBoundingBox

public static void allowGetBoundingBox(javax.media.j3d.Node target)
Used to setup for using getBoundingBox(), which must be done in a live scene. Sets the target object's capability bits for recursively determining its bounding box. Must be used while the target is not live. Any manually set bounds may be lost.

Parameters:
target - Node representing the object to be configured. Never null.

getBoundingBox

public static javax.media.j3d.BoundingBox getBoundingBox(javax.media.j3d.Node target,
                                                         javax.media.j3d.BoundingBox copy)
Gets an axis-aligned bounding box in world coordinates for the target object. The target must be live and the appropriate capability bits must have been set, such as with allowGetBoundingBox().

Parameters:
target - Node representing the target object. Never null.
copy - Container for the returned object, which must initially be empty.
Returns:
Reference to copy, which contains the target object bounding box.

getBoundingBox

public static javax.media.j3d.BoundingBox getBoundingBox(javax.media.j3d.Node target,
                                                         AppWorld world,
                                                         javax.media.j3d.BoundingBox copy)
Gets an axis-aligned bounding box in world coordinates for the target object. Makes no assumptions as to the state of the world or the capability bits of the target. If the target has no parent then it will be temporarily connected to the world to compute its bounding box, otherwise the target is assumed to be connected to the world.

The target object may be left with different and additional capability bits and any manually set bounds may be lost.

Parameters:
target - Node representing the target object. Never null.
world - World that the target belongs to.
copy - Container for the returned object, which must initially be empty.
Returns:
Reference to copy, which contains the target object bounding box.
